item.title: Ticket #2606 (Edits to page containing form data displays some form code in WP edit ...) updated
item.dc:creator: mdawaffe
item.description:
Keywords changed

The problem is the TEXTAREA element.

​http://sourceforge.net/tracker/?group_id=103281&atid=635682&func=detail&aid=1155822

This appears to be an unsupported feature of TinyMCE.

You have some options:

  1. Make the TEXTAREA the last element in your form and use CSS to put it back in the right place.
  2. Turn off rich editing whenever you want to edit that page. (Users->Your Profile, @ the bottom)
  3. Create a page template: ​http://codex.wordpress.org/Pages#Page_Templates

None of these fixes the bug, however. They're just workarounds.

Summary changed

Time is not kept track of well in wp There should only be a post_date, no post_date_gmt. Store everything in gmt. The difficult part of the patch is more fixing wordpress to deal with the time in a logical manner.

item.title: Ticket #2605 (comments_popup_link() displays Add Comment when comments closed) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
-1

"Comments" in this case means either pings or regular comments. When comments are closed (and no comments have been received) but pings are open, people can still add a comment, either by pingback or trackback. The Trackback URI is typically displayed on the permalink, down by the comment form. If it says "no comments" and is unlinked, Trackback users are unlikely to leave Trackbacks (they won't know they can!)
